newsitem.title: CHINA: China jails "princeling" to 12 years for graft.
newsitem.headline: China jails "princeling" to 12 years for graft.

text.p: A court has sentenced a son of the disgraced former Communist Party chief of China's capital, Beijing, to 12 years in prison for economic crimes, officials said on Tuesday.

The Beijing Number One Intermediate People's Court had convicted and passed sentence on Chen Xiaotong, son of former Beijing party boss and Politburo member Chen Xitong, in June, a prosecution official said.
"Chen Xiaotong was sentenced for economic crimes," an official of the office under the Beijing city procuratorate responsible for crimes of corruption said in an interview.
The son of the man who ruled China's capital for about a decade had been jailed for 12 years, the official said.

However, he declined to comment on whether Chinese authorities planned to press charges against Chen Xitong, purged in April 1995 after a multi-million dollar corruption scandal rocked the Chinese capital.
